title: Quarkus does not initialize web servlets (in web.xml) on startup in production mode (in multimodule project)

labels.name: triage/wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
### Describe the bug

I'm interested in the migration of a JEE ".ear" application to Quarkus. I've attached a Quarkus 3 (3.0.0.CR2) multimodule project with a repository module, a service module, a resource (REST only) module, and an "admin" web module using ZK Framework.

If you run `quarkus dev`, you'll see the web module initialized:

`2023-04-26 17:10:43.293 INFO  [org.zko.zk.ui.htt.WebManager] (Quarkus Main Thread) Starting ZK 9.6.3 EE (build: 2022102511)`

But ZK isn't initialized by running uber-jar or  `java -jar root/target/root-1.0-runner.jar`

This POC is very important for me because Quarkus is dozen times faster than an Application Server and I need its performance, so I would like to move to Quarkus. Indeed, I have seen that the migration of code is not very costly as JEE and Microprofile have a lot of common features.

I need a multimodule project because the repository module is shared with the resource module (public API of the system), the web "admin" module, and the service module. The "admin" web module uses the service m√≥dule as well.

I even wonder if it would be possible to have two ZK Framework web modules in the same project... 

[hermes.tar.gz](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/11334542/hermes.tar.gz)



### Expected behavior

Run the attached project using  `java -jar root/target/root-1.0-runner.jar` and get the web module initialized:

`2023-04-26 17:10:43.293 INFO  [org.zko.zk.ui.htt.WebManager] (Quarkus Main Thread) Starting ZK 9.6.3 EE (build: 2022102511)`




### Actual behavior

The web project is initialized only in dev mode

### How to Reproduce?

Use the attached project

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux szarza 6.2.12-200.fc37.x86_64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Apr 20 23:38:29 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.6" 2023-01-17 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (Red_Hat-17.0.6.0.10-1.fc37) (build 17.0.6+10) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (Red_Hat-17.0.6.0.10-1.fc37) (build 17.0.6+10, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.0.0 CR2

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
